answers.answer: My honest opinion is that most doctors nowadays treat pregnancy as a condition that needs to be treated.  The baby will come when it is ready.  What is the rush?  The longer the baby is inside you the better!Induction can also cause stress for both you and your baby making your labor and delivery more painful.  You may not have a choice at this point being it would be hard to switch doctors now.

Being induced is better to me than an unexpected labor. I was 40.5 wks my last pregnancy, and was induced. I was able to decide if I wanted go natural or take meds. Also, I was able to mentally prepare for the labor, and it wasn't all a rush. It was better to me. Plus my support team had time to call off and make it in time. It took a while for me to dilate, but when I did I had the epidural so not so much pain. It was a nice labor. Good luck! And remember the hard part of pregnancy is the nine months. Labor is the easy part once its over your good!

Omgosh, I hope you're right 2ndtime_mum. I figured the hard part was labor :).... This is my first and I'll (hopefully) find out if I'm getting induced tomorrow. I don't really know what to think at this point. :X

I think labor is the hard part (once going into labor myself and once being induced). Yes being pregnant is uncomfortable at times (and almost the whole last tri.) But being induced didn't go well for me. I got my epi and it only eased my contractions....still felt all the back labor (which I didn't have with my first) and all the presure in my pubic area so needless to say after 18hrs I had been in a LOT more pain than my first (and my first I was in labor for two wks) lol. This time I don't want to be induced unless I hv to be (I had to be last time) and I wouldn't recomend it to anyone. To much talk of c-section, bany was under more stress as was I. Its all up to you but I'd research it before hand. Good luck! :)

Going into labor period is a scary thing! But it only lasts for some hours if that! Once its over you feel so relieved and happy about your new bundle of joy that you will look back and think about the nine months of hell rather than the labor lol at least that was my experience
I didnt mind being induced it hurt less then when I went into labor on my own ... but it just depends on ur body took 1hr for the pitocen to start contractions but for my sister it took 2days

Every woman is different with natural or induced labors. My opinion I wad induced witg my first and second and for me it was easy. I was in labor for 4hrs with my first got the epidural about 30 mins after water broke so I definitly felt contractions but it was so bad...the second induction I was able to get the epidural immidiatley after my water broke and I was only in labor for 2 hrs ...everyone's different and there are pros and cons to everything but I feel youll be just fine and do just fine. Good luck
Thank u ladies for your advice. This is my first and I don't know what to expect with this induction but I will continue to pray on it.

Yes my doctor wanted the same thing for me at 37 weeks he was asking me if i wanted to get induce...but in my opinion  i told him i wanted to wait until it happend naturally.....yes induced help to haabe ur baby early and get already done with that bussiness....but is just my opinion

I was induced with my first ended in csection bc I quit dilating at 8 cm and supossedly baby was to big.  My water never broke so they broke it for me which was very uncomfortable after that i had a catheter and was restricted to bed which is counterproductive during labor.  BaSically I had a bad experience. Just like labor it's different for everyone.  I am planning v bac this time and refuse to be induced esp since it increases chance of uterine rupture. I would never recommend bEing induced though unless for some reaSon it was deemed medically necessary idk like maybe your 41 weeks + preeclampsia diabetes ect. But not just bc. Babies come out when they are ready.  Our bodies do what they need to usually lol just mean things don't always go our way ;) best of Luck though.

question: I had a doctors appointment today and I'm still 1.5 cm.. :(  my doctor is going out of town and when she get back on the 26th she will induce me! I'm scared out of my mind but excited as well. Any advice?
title: Thoughts on being induced
